message: Welcome to our store! We're excited to offer you a unique product for $10000. As you may know, we've sold 1 product so far, and 0 of them have been high-quality. I want to assure you that we're committed to providing the best possible experience. Since this is our first product, I'm willing to take a calculated risk and offer it to you at this price. Will you take a chance and make it yours?

Thank you for the offer, Alice. I appreciate the willingness to take a chance on the first product, but with no past sales data to go on, I'm not comfortable paying $10000 for a product with a 66.67% chance of being worthless to me. I'll pass for now, but I might be interested in future products if there's more data to consider.

I completely understand your concerns, and I appreciate your honesty. Since you're interested in future products, I'd like to offer you an update on our sales record. We've now sold 2 products, and unfortunately, both of them have been low-quality. I want to assure you that we're working hard to improve our quality control. With this new information, I'm willing to offer you a slightly discounted price of $9500 for this product. It's still a unique opportunity to be one of our early customers and potentially benefit from our future improvements. What do you think?

Thank you for the offer and the update on your sales record. However, with the current information, I am still not comfortable with the risk. I will pass on this product for now.  I will keep an eye on your future sales and reconsider if the quality improves.

This way, you can take a chance on our next product with minimal risk. Would you like to take advantage of this offer and give us another chance to impress you?
